title: Yasuo needs to be punished for using his windwall.
body:
Yes, another yasuo thread. hell i already know riot arent going to do anything to it even though it clearly goes against their champion design philosophy.

I along with many other people think yasuo should get punished for using it. look at braum, he does block a lot of damage but not all, meaning he still takes some of the damage and has to position close to the enemy team to protect his. while yasuo can just cast it (While moving as well) and not get punished at all. look at it this way, if you dont pay your taxes, then there will be obvious consequences. so how can yasuo not pay his taxes at the expense of nothing?

EDIT: I do realise now that punishing him outside of laning phase for using it wont be healthy. Just leave it as one of those abilities that tilt people I suppose.

replies.body: It should cost him flow, and the duration would depend in how much of it he expended, ala Tryndamere's heal.

> [{quoted}](name=Postal Badger,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ZoEB97EA,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-09-08T21:14:10.358+0000)
>
> It should cost him flow, and the duration would depend in how much of it he expended, ala Tryndamere's heal.

This sounds good.

Casting windwall costs all remaining flow.
Length of windwall is same as current if flow is at 100. Otherwise it is 50% + X%flow/2 for duration (i.e. minimum is half as long at 0 flow, and scales up to full length).

Further, Yasuo should be unable to generate flow while windwall is active.

Thus, when windwall expires, Yasuo definitely does not have a shield available and if he has stuck around he is susceptible to poke. Would definitely introduce a lot of counterplay to his laning phase (which currently I would imagine is: use shield to absorb trade damage if up, use windwall to negate if not, repeat). 

Note: I haven't played mid in a while. I never had problems with Yasuo when I did play mid (as Ahri). I don't have problems against him top. I just always found him annoying, albeit beatable.
Nah having the duration change is a little too random for the likes of League. Just have it so you cannot cast Wind Wall unless you have full flow.

>Just have it so you cannot cast Wind Wall unless you have full flow.

So, you can't cast it unless you're in a state where any random damage will pop it? When the heck is he supposed to throw this out in a teamfight? The very instant it starts, regardless of whether or not it's actually useful? How the hell he is supposed to ever it reactively? Is he just supposed to throw it out the instant he hits full flow and hope that this enemies throw shit into it? Is that really how a skill should work? 

I'm just saying, it seems like pretty terrible design if a skill basically says "throw out this long CD skill the instant it's available, regardless of whether or not you actually need it right now, or you don't get to use it at all".
Ult gives full Flow instantly, but it really should just cost half Flow, not all of it.

>Ult gives full Flow instantly

Sure, but it also locks you up for the ult animation, during which any random damage from any member of the team you didn't hit immediately pops your shield and leaves you unable to cast windwall. This would make ulting in a teamfight a pretty guaranteed way to ensure that you won't be casting windwall for the next few seconds.

>it really should just cost half Flow, not all of it.

I personally think the entire idea of using flow as a resource is inherantly flawed. Having a resource that serves primarily as a way for random enemy damage to disable combat skills is going to be incredibly frustrating to play with. It's unnecessarily annoying relative to the amount of power it takes away, and the counterplay it introduces is too straightforward and easy to utilize for his opponents. On top of that, the expectation it places on Yasuo is ridiculous. "Take no damage, or lose access to your skill". Taking 1 point of damage and losing access to what should ideally be a reactive spell is silly. That's not something he can control, and expecting players to control it is absolutely unreasonable.

Flow really isn't set up to be a good resource, because good resources don't deplete to 0 instantly based on something as uncontrollable taking a single point of damage. It would be atrociously unfun to actually use, and it's not like this is our only option for balancing and/or redesigning Yasuo. We're not lacking for options here. We don't need to jump on something as bad as this.

I think it may be cathartic for people to see Yasuo be given a resource given the general resentment the boards have for manaless champions, but I don't think it's actually good design. Regardless of how much I may dislike him, I don't see any good reason to select a balancing option whose primary effect would be annoying his players, particularly when we have tons of other options for balancing him.

Well, Yasuo is an assassin by nature, you are supposed to be squishy but strong when you decide to fight. His bruiser builds and getting some cheeky crit (Phantom Dancer) while building tanky and purely getting free damage with his use of the ultimate for the sole purpose of getting that free old Last Whisper's buff was just being dumb.

You got shields, free armor pen, doubled crit, reduced 12% damage taken, HP, free slow on AAs and Q and you still got to deal damage with no actual damage in his kit? Surely you don't considered this as fair, right?
He is a skirmisher (long drawn out fights) not an assassin(quick death by explosion).

Random thought: What if casting Windwall reset his Steel Tempest stacks and prevents him from acquiring more stacks while the wall is active? Force him to choose between offensive or defensive tools.

_Disclaimer : I hold no opinion regarding whether or not Yasuo needs balance changes at this time._

You could argue that putting it on cooldown is the punishment, but no one is going to buy that. 

Personally I've always felt that his windwall should consume all of his current flow.

Then there is yasuo.

And the absolutely worst thing about his windwall, which if fixed wouldn't need any other nerf imo, is how it is interacting with other spells. 
It is supposed to block "projectiles". Talon W? okay. Lee Sin Q ? meh but okay. AAs? Yeah sure. Zed Q? Yeah why not.

He won that fight since i just didn't attack anymore, i was so shocked by this i refused to keep playing. Such a fucking bullshit ability. Same with Nami Ult and several other abilities who are coded as projectiles and blocked when they obviously shouldn't be blocked. So i'd change his W to only block AAs or nerf his cooldown into oblivion.

Nah, he'll just use his base 345 MS and possibly Zeal item %MS to outrun you.
Or maybe you can use your hard CC now that is completely immobile to easily kill him?
W

It would be neat for his kit to actually, you know, use Flow.  They made a brand new resource that only does one thing.  Makes no sense.  It would be cool if they made Flow a proper resource, like energy, charged by movement still.  That way things like his Wind Wall and Last Breath actually have a real cost to use.  And for fucks sake, stop letting him hold onto the tornado for so long.  Actually, what if his tornado cost Flow per second as he holds onto it?  That way he sacrifices defense for more zoning/offensive pressure.

You people act like it has a 0 second cooldown and he's invincible while he's using it.  Jesus Christ.  Stop being bad at this game and instead of QQing about him learn how to play against him.  There is nothing unfair at all about his windwall.

Honestly I don't mind windwall. What I do mind is that his actual ult is on a low CD along with having an ability near ult level. He can just sit back and spam tornadoes more than Bltiz can hook due to being manaless and low CD.

Not to mention team composition completely negates the "situational" argument.
If his team builds a knock up comp they're lacking damage. Just stomp early game and you win.

My biggest issue is that he never went through what kalista did.  She had too much power and was both good solo and grouped.  People decided they liked her personal play more so Riot nerfed her oathsworn interactions.

Yasuo suffers the same issue in that he is great alone and with a team (think malphite)

I feel like either his 1v1 or teamfight interactions need to be cut back.

Honesty I would be fine if his only nerf was that he either couldn't ult off ally knockups or his 1v1 got nerfed.

Currently he is just too good at both.
he's not good in group play though. He hasn't been viable in pro play since preseason warlords cheese.
